issue.title: [C++] Preserve "ordered" metadata in some special cases in dictionary unification
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4096](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4096). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
In the event that all dictionaries are prefixes of a common dictionary, and all have ordered=true (note: this is not the same thing as being sorted), the resulting unified dictionary can also have ordered=true

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4096?focusedCommentId=16931652) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Perhaps we should also error out if not all dictionaries have the same "ordered"?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4096?focusedCommentId=17565589) by @toddfarmer:*

Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
